intro: Tashiroea biglandularis, commonly known as the Japanese thistle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are covered in dense, glandular hairs, which give it the "biglandularis" part of its name. Tashiroea biglandularis is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
